title: Biological and chemical weapons proliferation – OWID based on Arms Control Association (2022), Nuclear Threat Initiative (2022), Center for Nonproliferation Studies (2008) and the UN (2022)
description:
This dataset provides information on countries activities' on biological and chemical weapons, using information from Arms Control Association (2022), Nuclear Threat Initiative (2022), Center for Nonproliferation Studies (2008), the UN (2022), and a few supplementary sources.

You can download the code and complete dataset, including supplementary variables and country profiles with additional information, from GitHub: https://github.com/owid/notebooks/tree/main/BastianHerre/biological_chemical_weapons

fields.name: bioweapons_status_current
fields.description:
The variable identifies whether a country pursues, possesses, or has recently used biological weapons, using information from Arms Control Association (2022), Nuclear Threat Initiative (2022), Center for Nonproliferation Studies (2008) and the UN (2022).

A country is coded as pursuing biological weapons if it is increasing its capabilities or has a dedicated program. A country is coded as possessing biological weapons if it has weapons which it can deliver.

The variable also identifies when a country was alleged by another country of pursuing, possessing, or using biological weapons, but these allegations have not been confirmed by the country itself or impartial observers.

fields.name: bioweapons_status_current_num
fields.description:
The variable identifies whether a country pursues, possesses, or has recently used biological weapons, using information from Arms Control Association (2022), Nuclear Threat Initiative (2022), Center for Nonproliferation Studies (2008) and the UN (2022).

A country is coded as pursuing biological weapons if it is increasing its capabilities or has a dedicated program. A country is coded as possessing biological weapons if it has weapons which it can deliver.

The variable also identifies when a country was alleged by another country of pursuing, possessing, or using biological weapons, but these allegations have not been confirmed by the country itself or impartial observers.

A country receives a score of 0 if it neither pursues nor possesses biological weapons, and a score of 1 if it allegedly pursues them.

fields.name: bioweapons_status_hist
fields.description:
The variable identifies whether a country ever pursued, possessed, or used biological weapons, using information from Arms Control Association (2022), Nuclear Threat Initiative (2022), Center for Nonproliferation Studies (2008) and the UN (2022).

A country is coded as having pursued biological weapons if it increased its capabilities or had a dedicated program. A country is coded as having possessed biological weapons if it had weapons which it could have delivered.

The closest a country got to using biological weapons ever is recorded.

The variable also identifies when a country was alleged by another country of pursuing, possessing, or using biological weapons, but these allegations have not been confirmed by the country itself or impartial observers.

fields.name: bioweapons_status_hist_num
fields.description:
The variable identifies whether a country ever pursued, possessed, or used biological weapons, using information from Arms Control Association (2022), Nuclear Threat Initiative (2022), Center for Nonproliferation Studies (2008) and the UN (2022).

A country is coded as having pursued biological weapons if it increased its capabilities or had a dedicated program. A country is coded as having possessed biological weapons if it had weapons which it could have delivered.

The closest a country got to using biological weapons ever is recorded.

The variable also identifies when a country was alleged by another country of pursuing, possessing, or using biological weapons, but these allegations have not been confirmed by the country itself or impartial observers.

A country receives a score of 0 if it neither pursued nor possessed biological weapons, a score of 1 if it allegedly pursued them, a score of 2 if it pursued them, a score of 3 if it allegedly possessed them, a score of 4 if it possessed them, and a score of 5 if it used biological weapons.

fields.name: bioweapons_convention
fields.description: The variable identifies whether a country ratified the Biological Weapons Convention, signed it, or neither signed nor ratified it, using data from the United Nations (2022).

fields.name: bioweapons_convention_num
fields.description: The variable identifies whether a country ratified the Biological Weapons Convention (score of 2), signed it (score of 1), or neither signed nor ratified it (score of 0), using data from the United Nations (2022).

fields.name: chemweapons_status_current
fields.description:
The variable identifies whether a country pursues, possesses, or has recently used chemical weapons, using information from Arms Control Association (2022), Nuclear Threat Initiative (2022), Center for Nonproliferation Studies (2008) and the UN (2022).

A country is coded as having recently used chemical weapons if it did so in the previous ten years. A country is coded as pursuing chemical weapons if it is increasing its capabilities or has a dedicated program. A country is coded as possessing chemical weapons if it has weapons which it can deliver. 'Recent' means the country used or allegedly used them within the last decade.

The variable also identifies when a country was alleged by another country of pursuing, possessing, or using chemical weapons, but these allegations have not been confirmed by the country itself or impartial observers.
